attributes.action: Regulate the behaviour of fuel retailers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
When oil was $140 per barrel, diesel was £1.25/litre.  Now it is $84 per barrel it is going down, according to Tesco and some other supermarkets, to £1.19.  So 30% decrease in cost, 3% decrease in retail.  Until we wake up in the UK and hold these people to account, we deserve all we get .
One last thought, Tesco sell diesel in Bicester for £1.22/L.  10miles up the road, where there is a Morrison’s, they are at £1.19.  Why’s that do you think?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
